data.title: Even minus odd
data.solution:
def fun(s):
    p = 0
    i = 0
    for j in s:
        if j.isalpha() and (ord(j)-65)%2==0: p += ord(j)-65
        elif j.isalpha(): i += ord(j)-65
    return p - i
s = input()

print(fun(s))
data.statement:
Given a string [[s]], output the difference between the sum of indices of even letters in alphabet and odd ones. Special characters, numbers or space will be ignored.

The index of a letter refers to its position in the alphabet, with {{A}} being {{0}}, {{B}} being {{1}}, and so on up to {{Z}} being {{25}}. 

Example: s = JARDEL

J = 9; A = 0; R = 17 ; D = 3 ; E = 4 ; L = 11

output : (4 + 0) - (9 + 17 + 3 + 11) = -36

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn: KEEP CALM AND CODE IN PYTHON :)

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn: THE IF CONTROL STRUCTURE OUTLINED ABOVE ALLOWS YOU TO SPECIFY WHAT SHOULD HAPPEN IF A PARTICULAR EXPRESSION EVALUATES TO TRUE. IT DOES NOT, HOWEVER, PROVIDE THE OPTION TO SPECIFY SOMETHING ELSE THAT SHOULD HAPPEN IN THE EVENT THAT THE EXPRESSION EVALUATES TO FALSE.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: IT DOES NOT, HOWEVER, PROVIDE THE OPTION TO SPECIFY SOMETHING ELSE THAT SHOULD HAPPEN IN THE EVENT THAT THE EXPRESSION EVALUATES TO FALSE.

data.constraints: All letters in [[s]] are in the upper case.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a string s, output the difference between the sum of indices of even letters in alphabet and odd ones. Special characters, numbers or space will be ignored.

The index of a letter refers to its position in the alphabet, with A being 0, B being 1, and so on up to Z being 25.

Example: s = JARDEL

J = 9; A = 0; R = 17 ; D = 3 ; E = 4 ; L = 11

output : (4 + 0) - (9 + 17 + 3 + 11) = -36
Input
s string to compute.
Output
One line containing the difference.
Constraints
All letters in s are in the upper case.
Example
Input
JARDEL
Output
-36
